title: NASA Selects Repairs Operations Maintenance and Engineering Contractor
summary: NASA has selected ASRC Federal Facilities Logistics, LLC, of Beltsville, Maryland for the Repairs, Operations, Maintenance and Engineering (ROME) contract.

title: FCC Reveals Framework For Satellite To Smartphone Connectivity
summary: The US FCC has proposed a new framework to regulate the use of terrestrial wireless spectrum from space for direct-to-device services.

title: Satellite maker Terran Orbital sees annual revenue climb near $100 million
summary: Terran Orbital, a specialist in manufacturing small satellites, reported fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, with annual revenue nearing $100 million as it continued to build its order backlog.

title: U.S. Air Force to test hardware at hypersonic speeds on Varda’s space capsules
summary: The U.S. Air Force plans to use startup Varda Space Industries’ reentry capsules as hypersonic flight test platforms

title: NASA Seeks Student Solutions for Managing Moon Landing Dust Cloud
summary: As NASA and industry partners develop new human landing systems to transport astronauts from lunar orbit to the Moon’s surface and back as part of Artemis, the agency is asking university students to investigate solutions to one particularly dusty aspect of landing spacecraft on the lunar surface.

title: ispace's HAKUTO-R M1 Lunar Lander Successfully Enters Moon Orbit
summary: ispace announced that its HAKUTO-R M1 Lunar Lander has successfully entered orbit around the Moon. The lander performed its first lunar orbit insertion manoeuvre at 10:24 (JST) on March 21, under the direction of ispace engineers at the HAKUTO-R Mission Control Center in Nihonbashi, Japan.

title: South Korea’s Innospace succeeds in test launch
summary: South Korean rocket startup Innospace successfully launched a suborbital rocket from Brazil over the weekend, demonstrating a hybrid motor it plans to scale up into a small orbital launch vehicle.

title: Kazakhstan’s seizure of Russian space assets threatens the Soyuz-5 rocket
summary: Russia has spent nearly $1 billion on the development of the new Soyuz-5 rocket.

title: Japanese lander enters lunar orbit
summary: A lunar lander developed by Japanese company ispace has entered orbit around the moon, setting up a lunar landing attempt by the end of April.

title: On National Security | Space Force and commercial industry taking relationship to the next level
summary: The U.S. Space Force is exploring the creation of a space equivalent of the civil reserve air fleet, or CRAF, a program the Pentagon conceived 70 years ago to gain access to commercial airlift capacity in an emergency.
